intro: Echites vestitus, commonly known as the hairy echites, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, which help it retain moisture in its natural habitat. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. The plant is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
